reviewText: This is my all time favorite sitcom with characters and situations way ahead of its time. Wonderful cast, sharp writing. Other than Jackie Gleason and Art Carney in the "Honeymooners", the hilarious  interplay of Eve Arden and Gale Gordon is unmatched by anything I've ever seen on TV. This show is rarely shown today so I'm glad to have found this collection. The video quality is only fair but the episodes are watchable, and that's all that matters to me. If you're a fan of early 1950's TV grab this ASAP.
Title: N/A

reviewText: These DVD's are so much fun to watch, especially if you are from the era in which they were taped.  They remind me a tad of I Love Lucy, which is another favorite of ours.  These are black and white of course, and a little grainy now and then, but not so much you want to shut them off.  Well worth the money.  If you like to chill out during the day or before bedtime (as we do) these are relaxing, fun shows to watch.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The only reason this gets a "4" instead of a "5" is that the picture quality is not very good, especially in some of the episodes.  These were from 1952, and the masters were probably lost, so we're fortunate to have them at all.  The soundtrack comes through loud and clear, and I have roared with laughter at the antics of Eve Arden, Jane Morgan (Mrs. Davis), Richard Crenna, and especially Gale Gordon (Mr;. Conklin, the principal).  This was one of the highlights of the '50's and should be remastered so that more people could get into it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Was a little disappointed about the quality of the video.  Is very light in places.  But I love the episodes of this video.  Not as good quality as the re-digitalized videos.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first program on this DVD set had horrible video quality.  It is too bad that tapes of "Our Miss Brooks" were not preserved in better condition.  That said, the rest of the programs are viewable.  I love the show so much, that this DVD set is better than nothing at all, even if the video quality is not very good.
summary: Better Than No "Our Miss Brooks" at All

reviewText: It looks to me as if whoever made these dvds did so from an old, unrestored VHS tape of the series.  There are obvious attempts being made to make the picture clearer and adjusting the sound to make it louder.  They failed miserably at both.  My advice is to save your money if you're expecting to receive a restored, clear picture and sound because you're going to receive the exact opposite.
Title: N/A
